channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Federal judge blocks CFPB from laying off more employees
item.description: The ruling from a federal court in Washington, D.C., is a reprieve for CFPB staff who had been bracing for mass layoffs as early as Friday.
item.content:encoded:
The ruling from a federal court in Washington, D.C., is a reprieve for CFPB staff who had been bracing for mass layoffs as early as Friday.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Laurel Wamsley

item.title: Trump firings cause chaos at agency responsible for America's nuclear weapons
item.description: The National Nuclear Security Administration is a semi-autonomous agency within the Department of Energy that oversees the U.S. stockpile of thousands of nuclear weapons. Officials were given hours to fire hundreds of employees.
item.content:encoded: The National Nuclear Security Administration is a semi-autonomous agency within the Department of Energy that oversees the U.S. stockpile of thousands of nuclear weapons. Officials were given hours to fire hundreds of employees.
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: HUD employees are bracing for what they hear will be 'drastic' staff cuts
item.description: As federal layoffs mount, sources say the Trump administration plans a 50% staffing cut at the federal housing agency. The moves come amid an affordable housing shortage and record high homelessness.
item.content:encoded:
As federal layoffs mount, sources say the Trump administration plans a 50% staffing cut at the federal housing agency. The moves come amid an affordable housing shortage and record high homelessness.

(Image credit: Alastair Pike)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: A judge orders a temporary thaw to Trump's foreign aid freeze. What will that mean?
item.description: He wrote that there was no explanation "why a blanket suspension of all congressionally appropriated foreign aid" is needed to review programs. But how funds will start flowing again is unclear.
item.content:encoded:
He wrote that there was no explanation "why a blanket suspension of all congressionally appropriated foreign aid" is needed to review programs. But how funds will start flowing again is unclear.

(Image credit: Hajarah Nalwadda/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Malaka Gharib

item.title: Fallout from Eric Adams case continues at the Justice Department
item.description: An order to dismiss the corruption case against New York Mayor Eric Adams has sent the Justice Department into a crisis. Several top prosecutors resigned rather than obey orders to dismiss the case.
item.content:encoded:
An order to dismiss the corruption case against New York Mayor Eric Adams has sent the Justice Department into a crisis. Several top prosecutors resigned rather than obey orders to dismiss the case.

(Image credit: Tierney L. Cross)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Access to Ukraine's rare earths may help keep U.S. aid flowing
item.description: As the Trump administration publicly hammers out its plans on the Ukraine war, it's also pressing Ukraine for deals in exchange for more aid — including giving the U.S. mining rights for rare earths.
item.content:encoded:
As the Trump administration publicly hammers out its plans on the Ukraine war, it's also pressing Ukraine for deals in exchange for more aid — including giving the U.S. mining rights for rare earths.

(Image credit: TOBIAS SCHWARZ)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Layoffs accelerate at federal agencies with more cuts to come
item.description: Federal agencies continued to lay off workers Friday. The cuts come after President Trump signed an executive order this week directing agencies to prepare for "large-scale" reductions in force.
item.content:encoded:
Federal agencies continued to lay off workers Friday. The cuts come after President Trump signed an executive order this week directing agencies to prepare for "large-scale" reductions in force.

(Image credit: Alastair Pike)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: The Iconic Singer of the Syrian Revolution
item.description: Syria is reinventing itself following a 14-year bloody civil war and the rapid crumbling of the regime of Bashar Al-Assad regime in December. As NPR's Emily Feng travelled the country reporting on the new Syria, she kept seeing one man's face on flags, posters and vehicles everywhere she went. So, she decided to find out more about him.
item.content:encoded: Syria is reinventing itself following a 14-year bloody civil war and the rapid crumbling of the regime of Bashar Al-Assad regime in December. As NPR's Emily Feng travelled the country reporting on the new Syria, she kept seeing one man's face on flags, posters and vehicles everywhere she went. So, she decided to find out more about him.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Former Kennedy Center president speaks out in first interview since her firing
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks to Deborah Rutter, former head of the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, in her first interview since the board installed President Trump as its new chair.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks to Deborah Rutter, former head of the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, in her first interview since the board installed President Trump as its new chair.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Altimeter in Black Hawk helicopter may have malfunctioned before DCA mid-air collision
item.description: The National Transportation Safety Board says altimeter in the Black Hawk helicopter may have malfunctioned before the DCA mid-air collision with an American Airlines jet. All 67 people aboard died.
item.content:encoded:
The National Transportation Safety Board says altimeter in the Black Hawk helicopter may have malfunctioned before the DCA mid-air collision with an American Airlines jet. All 67 people aboard died.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: Russell Lewis
